text: We open on BETHESDA FOUNTAIN in the heart of New York’s Central Park, then we pull up and away, hurtling backward over the city until we come to rest in TIMES SQUARE, whic has been blocked off for an EPIC STREET RACE.

Huge crowds line the street, cheering on TWENTY EXOTIC VEHICLES waiting at the starting line. A MOTORBIKE straight from Road Warrior idles on the outsi lane. Most of the other racers are in STOCK CARS, every driver wearing the same helmet. These are SIXERS, we’ll get back to them later. Interspersed with the Sixers are vehicles of every variet And when I say every variety I mean that some of them are cars, and some of them are hover craft, and one of them i BLIMP with a jet engine on it. Their drivers are every size, shape and color, too. They called GUNTERS. That too will be on the quiz. The closer we get to the West Side of 7th Avenue, the mor Gunters there are. The second to last car is probably the most bad-ass of the lot, a replica of DECKARD’S SPINNER f BLADE RUNNER. AECH, a handsome guy with the shoulders of a linebacker, checks the OVERSIZED ENGINE strapped to the roof.
Lemme guess - Mario Kart? He turns to see PARZIVAL, standing beside his vintage DELOREAN, literally the car from BACK TO THE FUTURE. He’s nineteen years old, good-looking and fit.
No. Designed it myself, actually. Bad ass, right?
It’s very Nintendo. Their friendly rivalry requires busting on each other constantly.
Better than your p.o.s. level 4 skin over a level 1 frame.
Weird that I’m still gonna outrace you. What does that say?
It says you’re delusional, Z. I’m in the two spot. No way you get farther.
Let’s see who makes it past 57th. A SIREN signals the drivers to get in their cars. Parziva makes a fist, Aech returns the salute.
First to the key.
First to the egg. And they get in their cars.

A GUNSHOT starts the race and the cars roar onto Seventh Avenue. Almost immediately, an Eighteen Wheeler runs a re light and A THIRD OF THE CARS RAM RIGHT INTO IT. And they literally explode. Just like that. Boom, half th cars are incinerated. Nobody bats an eye or stops cheerin
Parzival stomps on the accelerator, chasing Aech's dust. bump and jockey for position, but Parzival is careful to avoid all of them, steering with tremendous precision.

Metal walls suddenly pop up from the street, incongruousl and with pretty much no logic to their placement. More of Sixer vehicles CRASH or SPIN OUT. Aech has already passed them, and Parzival simply veers through the debris.
Dumbasses. You don’t start from the outside lanes. He catches up with Aech, and, as they HANG a LEFT on 45th street, he cuts past him on the inside. Parzival’s winning. For now.

Parzival hangs a RIGHT on 8th Avenue and puts the pedal t the floor. On every block, a different obstacle emerges, each time another driver is taken out. SINKHOLES open at street, a MANIAC WITH A FLAMETHROWER sprays the intersect at 50th street, and at 54th street... A T-REX stomps out into the street and Parzival nimbly swerves between its legs, just as its massive jaws POP TH BLIMP. It’s not your typical street race. EXT. 57TH STREET —- CONTINUOUS Parzival turns right at 57th to get back over to Seventh Avenue, and now AECH suddenly BOMBS OUT OF NOWHERE and PA HIM. He flips Parzival the bird as he makes a left back onto seventh. Parzival settles in behind him. Up ahead, a few blocks away, is CENTRAL PARK. But before that is 58th street. The whole block is in an exaggerated state of construction, like an obstacle cours leading up to A COLLAPSING CRANE. It’s all a matter of timing and angle to get past the collapsing crane, and Aech tries to take it AS SHARP AND FAST as he can. He clears the falling CRANE, but he’s going too fast. He SKIDS OUT, and his car FLIPS OVER. A MOMENT LATER, Parzival DRIFTS PAST HIM, going just a bi slower. His DeLorean SKIDS, but he makes the turn.
Yes!

A CEMENT TRUCK is backing up, narrowing the space Parziv can drive through. He GUNS THE ENGINE, trying to get over fast enough to get past the TRUCK before it seals him off But he’s too late. The DeLorean SLAMS into the truck, whi EXPLODES WITH WET CEMENT. AECH APPROACHES the smoking, cement-covered DeLorean, as Parzival climbs out through its dented gull-wing doors.
Really thought I was gonna make it.
I’m telling you, it’s rigged.
Dude, don’t go there.

No other explanation. Their conversation is interrupted by the ROAR OF AN ENGIN They turn to see the ROAD WARRIOR MOTORBIKE ZOOM PAST THE seemingly headed straight for the truck, which now has th street completely blocked off.
This should be ugly. The MOTORBIKE suddenly veers off the street and INTO THE CONSTRUCTION ZONE. It plows over cones, then hits a stret of BROKEN SIDEWALK, one piece angled UP, and RAMPS OFF IT
Aech and Parzival exchange a glance, then chase after the motorbike.

THE ROAD WARRIOR BIKE speeds towards camera, fifty yards from the park entrance. The driver is stoic, completely focused, absolutely determined to make it, and that’s whe A METEOR (yes, I’m serious, a meteor) plunges from the sk and slams into the street. The RIDER has to BAIL OUT as t BIKE slams into the smoking rock and EXPLODES.  EXT. CENTRAL PARK —- CONTINUOUS Parzival and Aech run up to the wreckage. The RIDER emerg from the smoke, whipping off her helmet, revealing...

A meteor?! Seriously? Aech and Parzival gape at a woman in her early twenties; raven hair, big hazel eyes, rounded cheekbones and a perpetual smirk. She HURLS HER HELMET at the Meteor. It too explodes.
You almost made the park, you realize how huge that is?
Do I have the key? No. Not huge.
(star struck) Hey. You’re Artemis!
Yeah, I know. She walks past them. Parzival, staring, has lost whatever sense of cool he seemed to possess.
I love you. I mean... we love you.
(interrupting) What he means is, we’re big fans. We've read your stuff, seen your channel...
You should come with us!
(to Aech) He always like this?
No. (to Z, under his breath) Dude, act like you’ve met a girl before.
I just mean... to talk about Halliday, and the Egg. And the race.
You guys are gunters? I mean, serious, not just jerking off on the weekend...?
Not jerking off on weekends at all.
My socially inept friend here was the first to 49th, first to 55th...
Wait a minute... you’re Parzival.
Yeah, I know. Artemis smiles, touche. She turns to Aech.

So where is your place anyway? INT. AECH’S BASEMENT - OASIS A suburban rec room, circa the early 1980's. Movie and co book posters cover the wood-paneled walls. A vintage RCA television is hooked up to a Betamax, a LaserDisc player, several vintage videogame consoles, most prominently an A 2600.
Wow. Aech leads Artemis in, Parzival right behind.
Show her the workshop. Aech, ahead of him, kicks open the door to what should be closet...

Completely out of proportion to the room, Aech's garage i enormous space filled with exotic vehicles, including replicas of the BATMOBILE, PEE WEE’S BICYCLE, and most impressively...  An unfinished replica of a familiar GIANT ROBOT.
Is that...
The Iron Giant? Yeah, just got the commission for it. No big deal. Artemis checks out the surface of the enormous, stylized robot. The unfinished parts of it are still a 3D grid.
Aech’s work is top rated on the modboards.
(shrugging) It’s mostly about getting the right skins, what you can license, you know? Like Matrix, Matrix kids, forget it, but Star Wars, Marvel, Dark Knight, the classic Ridley Scotts...
Golden Age Spielberg?
Pre-Jurassic is a bitch.
Always wanted the Mothership from Close Encounters.
Yeah, tough to find.
Tough to park. Artemis laughs. Parzival lights up.
Never thought of that.
Oh, yeah, handling is an issue. I mean you can’t build a Giant Robot and have it ride like a Buick Regal.
Buick... ?
A shitty car from Halliday’s time.

Right. Aech pulls the door shut. Music comes up... TEMPTATION, b NEW ORDER, the original Factus 8 version, not the remix.. INT. AECH’S BASEMENT Artemis bops around the room checking the place out. She comes to THE HALLIDAY WALL, which is loaded with memorabi (And no, we don’t know who he is yet, but we’re getting there.)

Whoa, great collection here. Most prominently, the classic magazine cover from JANUARY 2040, the day Halliday died. It’s the photo of him in fad jeans and a vintage Space Invaders T-shirt, the headline JAMES HALLIDAY, 1972-2040.
So you're checking my private Gunter stash - where's the quid pro quo? (off her look) The jump. Artemis debates whether or not to tell them.
The sidewalk is cracked. Had to be a reason, there always is with Halliday.
Exactly. That’s what I’ve been saying.
Please, not the “theory” again...
“Theory”?
The challenge is unwinnable. It’s designed to drive us nuts.
Halliday wouldn’t do that.
Maybe he just made a mistake? I mean, there was no one to bug test it.
No way, he never made mistakes.
Well... not totally true. They both turn to look at him.
He once screwed up a level of Flunkie Sprat Three.
Wow, that is some seriously deep cut triv, Z. I gotta admit, you are as hardcore a Halliday nerd as anyone I’ve ever met. Parzival blushes a bit. Aech notices this.
We’re gunters. “First to the key...”
“,.. first to the egg.” She looks from Parzival to Aech, sizing them up.
So how come you guys aren't ina clan? Parzival shakes his head.
Thank you, I’ve told him a million times we'd be better off working together. But Z thinks the only way someone wins is solo.
Tell that to IOI and the Sixers.  10.
(quickly) They won't win. Halliday won’t let them.
He’s dead, dude.
The Oasis was his baby. He wouldn’t set it up for some corporate borg- spawn.
(aside, to Artemis) He gets a little touchy about the whole Halliday thing, thinks they have some sort of bond.
No, that’s not... I just think I understand the guy, maybe because...
Parzival is interrupted by a disembodied voice that echoe out over the room, though only he seems to hear it.
Because why?
Wade! Have you seen my gloves?
Oh, crap. Artemis looks at him quizzically.
Sorry, it was awesome meeting you. Gotta split. And with that, PARZIVAL SUDDENLY DISAPPEARS...

And now we see WADE WATTS, the “real” Parzival, in the re world.  11. He’s inside an 80’s vintage van with fogged over windows, wearing a HAPTIC VISOR, which he quickly pulls off. “Parzival” is an idealized version of Wade, in reality he shy and gangly, sporting worn corduroys and a baggy sweat And a pair of I0I-branded HAPTIC GLOVES.

They’re not on my desk. Where they should be. The conversation with his Aunt switches from the visor to mobile headset the size of a dime on his earlobe. Wade tucks the gloves into a backpack and scrambles out o the van, pushing past boxes of busted laptops, computer p and old car batteries.
The VAN is buried under other junked vehicles, arranged perfectly so it’s hidden from the outside world. Wade loc the door behind him, keeping the conversation going.
Why would I take your gloves?
Because you spend every waking moment in the Oasis and you don’t have your own.
Wade emerges from the mound of old cars into an empty playground. He checks to make sure no one saw him come ou his secret hideout, then keeps moving.
Where are you, anyway?
I’m out with some friends.
You don’t have any friends.

Wade has now arrived at his destination: THE STACKS.  12. Dozens of MOBILE HOMES stacked on top of each other, connected by a makeshift network of recycled pipes, girde and support beams. There are a dozen Stacks in all, the future’s version of suburban tract housing.
I actually just met someone I really like.
A real person?

Funny. The lower trailers -- and other empty wall spaces -- are punctuated with the occasional bit of political graffiti. Most of the references are to “IOI”, an organization that seems particularly unpopular with people who like writing slogans on walls. As he runs through the streets, he passes two kids wearin “REB” t-shirts; a picture of a leader called “JC3” in the same vein as Che Guevara. They take potshots at overhead DELIVERY DRONES with air rifles. They wing one of the drones which sputters and falls, alm hitting a stray dog. Wade MUTES his headset for a moment as he hustles past th
What the hell, guys?
IOI, brah. Gotta stop ‘em.
By shooting someone’s tube socks out of the sky?
Stuff it in your suckchute, loser.
(to himself) Suckchute, that's new.

Still need my gloves, Wade. Wade jumps up and grabs on to the skeletal metal structur that keeps the whole stack in place. He starts CLIMBING.  13. EXT. WADE’S STACK - NIGHT We follow Wade as he scrambles up the outside of the stac The climb grows increasingly perilous as he goes. Physica Wade’s no specimen, but this is one thing in the real wor that he is actually good at.

Just remembered where they are. He finally reaches his unit. He peers through the BATHROO WINDOW, then climbs through it. INT. WADE’S HOME - BATHROOM - NIGHT In the pitch dark bathroom, Wade cracks the door and can see his AUNT ALICE, 30’s and haggard in a meth-y kind of standing in the living room.
They’re in the kitchen. On top of the fridge. Alice turns to look at the kitchen, AWAY from Wade. When starts to walk in that direction, Wade makes his move.

Wade dashes into the messy, cramped living room. He quick stashes the gloves under the COUCH CUSHIONS, then walks a quietly as he can to the front door. Alice, annoyed, paces back into the living room...
I can’t be late again. ++. just as Wade walks IN through the front door.
They're right there, Alice. He points to the gloves, sticking out from under the couc cushions.
See? I didn’t have em. Alice, slightly chastened, takes the gloves from him, the settles into a recliner.  14.
That is bull pucky, amigo. A FLUSH from the bathroom as RICK, Alice’s white trash boyfriend, walks into the living room. Wade grimaces, realizing...
You were in there when...
Fell asleep, it was a long one. (to Alice) This lying bastard had the gloves. Rick continues past them and into the kitchen. Alice glar at Wade.
Damnit Wade, bad enough you don’t have a job without screwing up mine. Now you can’t use ‘em at all.
What? But I... Alice waves him away, slipping on her IOI gear. She speak into her official IOI headset and waves her hands awkward
(monotone) This way, please... Wade glares at Rick, now tugging on a beer. Rick shrugs.

Wade enters the tiny slice of the unit he calls his room. Outside his window, like a cruel taunt, is a giant billbo advertising a SHAPTIC@ BRAND HAPTIC BOOTSUIT, a totally badass immersion rig for logging in to the Oasis. The BILLBOARD advertisement reads “Log In!” and features muscular guy modeling a suit that promises “Total Interfa and “Real-time Neuromuscular Response!” Hold on Wade, staring up at that ad.  15. INT. WADE’S HOUSE - THE NEXT DAY (REAL WORLD) Wade wakes up, wipes the sleep from his eyes. It might be from spending too much time in the Oasis, but there’s a moment of hopefulness, like maybe he’s someplace awesome. But nope, same crappy apartment, same billboard taunting INT. WADE’S HOUSE - MORNING Wade pours himself a bowl of cereal and milk water (milk- flavored water). From the kitchen table, through an open door, Wade can see into his aunt’s bedroom. Alice is passed out from a long night of work, Rick lies asleep on top of her, drooling. Wade cringes. CLOSE ON -- the HAPTIC GLOVES and VISOR sitting on Alice’ desk. They’re YANKED out of frame --
Back in his hideout, Wade slips his VISOR on, then logs i He sees the last three words anyone sees before leaving t real world for the Oasis:
INCIPIO, the MAIN PLANET of the Oasis, is a giant city fi with every building or structure, real or fictional, you possibly imagine.

When Halliday first built the Oasis, it was an open-world, massively-multiplayer online game. Over time it grew into way more than that. Parzival suddenly appears, mid stride. He passes the Eiff Tower next to the Taj Mahal, with EXXON/WHOLEFOODS corpor headquarters jammed between them.
One of his biggest ideas was tying your avatar into your DNA, using their proprietary software. One account per person, no exceptions. (MORE )

Everyone started equal in the Oasis. And it was free. Parzival opens his HUD, his “heads up display” which appe as a seamless interface with the world around him. He has gamer attributes -- SPEED, STRENGTH, MAGIC, AIM -- and an INVENTORY for weapons, spells, and vehicles.

Your avatar was fully upgradeable, but that took experience. And money. The DELOREAN is in there, currently marked “damaged”. The price to fix it is 5,000 gold coins. His account has a balance of 4,560.

(using a voice command) Locate Aech. An image of AECH comes up; like the graphics over any spo broadcast, his avatar moves and poses and winks. “LOCATING...” appears. Wade continues on his way, passing through what looks lik the heart of the city. Off to his right is the main GREGARIOUS GAMES headquarters, a gleaming, castle-like to

Once the Oasis took off, Halliday'’s partner Ogden Morrow got pushed out. Since Halliday died, no one knew exactly who ran the Oasis anymore. But a good guess? Just down the block from Gregarious is IOI HEADQUARTERS, massive, corporate monstrosity.

IOI, Innovative Online Industries. They build the haptic gear. The gloves, the visors... INT. WADE’S HIDEOUT - THE REAL WORLD Wade lies in his haptic rig, a series of quick cuts of TH IOI LOGO, on Wade’s gloves, visor, the boots... IOI has t name on everything.  17.
Back in Incipio...
Which means they control most people’s access to the Oasis. Parzival checks his HUD, Aech is still being “located”.
Halliday kept IOI in line. But now? Well if you asked the rebels, IOI’s plan was to turn the Oasis into a hellish place where rules were numerous and always followed.
S'up, Z? AECH now appears in a window in a close-up, clearly real footage. Wherever he is it’s loud and dusty, and bursts o smoke and gunfire make it difficult to see and hear.
What the hell are you doing?
I'm trying to win the musket of infinite velocity.
But people loved the Oasis ‘cause it was free. At least in spirit, you could do anything. The camera suddenly TAKES OFF, shooting away from Parziva
And into OUTER SPACE.

Halliday built an entire universe, something for everyone... We SHOOT ACROSS THE GALAXY, passing countless planets... One of them seems to be a huge SPACECRAFT, IMPOSSIBLY LAR But as we pass it we see that it is the LETTER “S"”, floa in space. The rest of the word is so big we can’t make it from this perspective.  18.

Which is how you end up with a place like Planet Doom. We approach a planet that seems to have beautiful and elaborate weather systems swirling around it. As we get closer, we realize that the “weather” is actually EXPLOSI from a never-ending war.

The first gamers in the Oasis walked around blowing each other away right in front of everyone else. Halliday realized he needed to draw some boundaries. He divided the Oasis into combat zones, or PVP, and non-combat zones. As we descend from the atmosphere, we pass over “The Dark Side” of Planet Doom, which is sealed off from the war zo by a giant wall known as Anorak’s Fence.
He migrated all the most violent first person shooters to one planet. One giant PVP zone.
We swoop in from the atmosphere to reveal a perfectly rendered vision of the battle of Appomattox, with some sm changes.
Who you up against? Mixed in with the soldiers are a bunch of avatars that ar way out of context.
The South. But also Aliens. And the Roman Legion, I think. Aech is on the Union side, a musket with one hand, and a futuristic BLASTER in the other.
Think I might’ve figured something out. Wanna swing by the journals and take another run at the key?

Wish I could.  19. As he moves across the field, Aech shoots an Alien with h musket, then a Confederate soldier with his blaster. As t explode, their COINS shower to the ground. A VACUUM TUBE Aech’s shoulder sucks them right into his inventory.
This sesh has got another five hours, minimum. DAMNIT! Aech just got winged in the ribs by an enchanted ARROW.
Aech was my best friend in the Oasis, probably my best friend period, even though I'd never met him. Aech launches himself into the fray, racking up kills.
He also had a lot of stuff, including a dope spaceship. So I was always hitting him up for rides.
Aech’s window disappears, so Parzival toggles his HUD to navigation.
(voice command) Memoir-opolis. A pathway suddenly lights up in front of him, showing him path to take.

The Oasis was like the real world in that respect; the more money you had, the more stuff you got, and the more stuff, the easier it was to get around, and thus get even more stuff. Wade heads towards a train station. The train tracks head AND OFF THE PLANET.
I think that’s why Halliday’s challenge was such a big deal. It wasn’t just the money. (MORE )
For someone like me, it was the chance to go from peasant to king in a heartbeat. Wade takes a seat on a bench at the train station, waitin for his ride.
Like everyone else, I remember exactly where I was the day the contest was announced... the day James Halliday died.

A giant, virtual classroom. PARZIVAL is one of a thousand avatars sitting and listening to a virtual ALBERT EINSTEI teach them rudimentary science. Suddenly, everyone in the room gets an alert... JAMES HALLIDAY, DEAD AT 62.

WADE, 13 years old, rips his early-iteration headset off. eyes fill with tears. He is in his cozy childhood home. There are boxes everywh the family has just moved in. In the background, his FATH paints the living room wall while his MOTHER cooks dinner When she sees her boy crying, she runs over to comfort hi Despite the tragedy, clearly these were happier times for Wade.
At a funeral parlor, people dressed in black mourn before open casket... The body inside is JAMES HALLIDAY, shiny quarters cover e of his eyelids.
But it wasn’t his death that changed everything. It was his will.  21. IN THE CASKET -- Halliday’s avatar suddenly SITS UPRIGHT begins talking to camera.
Hello. I’m James Halliday. If you're watching this, I’m dead. He snaps his fingers and a SCROLL appears in his hand. He unfurls it to the floor and begins reading aloud...

I, James Donovan Halliday, do hereby declare this to be my last will and testament... A CAPTION at the bottom of the screen reads: “Halliday's Announcement" (archival footage property of GGS) INT. ANORAK’S CASTLE (OASIS) Now Halliday appears inside a castle as ANORAK, his avata tall, robed wizard with a slightly more handsome version Halliday's face.

Before I died, I created my own Easter egg, and hid it somewhere inside the OASIS. The first person to find the egg will inherit my entire fortune and earn complete control of the Oasis. A simple RHYME appears as a subtitle in front of Halliday he speaks.

Three hidden keys open three secret gates/ Wherein the errant will be tested for worthy traits/ And those with the skill to survive these straits/ Will reach the end where the prize awaits. Now here is the clue for the first key...

Parzival boards a high-speed train. His HUD IMAGE OF CRED appears and is lightened by 10 coins. Everything in the O costs something.  22. He takes a seat next to two ridiculously proportioned WOM who chat loudly. Parzival MUTES them.
The corporate overlords at IOI weren't as excited about the contest.
Push in on three sleek skyscrapers in gleaming downtown Columbus, Ohio in the shape of the letters IOI.
The thought of new ownership terrified them.
Inside the building, a sea of workers in rows of Haptic Decks. A buzzing hive of activity; like a trading firm, a working to solve Anorak’s challenge.
They started their own division of egg hunters. We see all of the IOI EMPLOYEES AVATARS have the same def outfits and instead of names, NUMBERS. All of them start a “six”.

We call em “Sixers” ‘cause that’s the rule, no name, just numbers. They put this Kardash named Nolan Sorrento in charge. AN INTERVIEW -- with a slick, ambitious guy in his fortie who is clearly trying to burnish his image. A chyron reads NOLAN SORRENTO, EXECUTIVE VP, IOI.
Sorrento was the lead sixer. The face of IOI's team. The program CUTS TO Sorrento giving a tour of his lavish home, trying to show a more human side.

I love games. I love being inside the Oasis.  23. Despite the fact that his whole house is luxurious, his r is particularly ostentatious: a rotating full body 3D Immersive Haptic Interface, like a hamster ball.
The one luxury I spoil myself with is the best haptic immersion rig money can buy. We see B-Roll of his enormous house, his attractive FAMIL His admittedly cute dog.
Despite the charm offensive, Sorrento was a scary dude. He made his bones in IOI’s security and adjustment division.

A younger Nolan Sorrento leads a team of jack-booted IOI thugs as they break down someone’s door. A TEN YEAR OLD G with a DISTINCTIVE BIRTHMARK watches as Sorrento reads of list of debts to her FATHER, then has him dragged out of house. The girl runs after her father, Sorrento sticks out his f and TRIPS HER.
Now he was in charge of IOI’s egg hunt, but you could tell his heart wasn’t in it. INT. SORRENTO’S HOME Sorrento’s interview continues...
At IOI, we love hunting for the egg, it’s part of what makes the Oasis so fun. It’s the least convincing expression of enthusiasm ever.
The TRAIN rockets up and out of the city, impossibly fast  24.

The first clue was easy, some long- forgotten gunter cracked it ina week. But the challenge -- the race through Times Square -- was incredibly hard. The train arrives at his stop, one of the many moons of Incipio. A sign at the station reads: MEMOIR-OPOLIS.

Five years went by and no one came close to beating it. Most people gave up. The sixers couldn’t, they had no choice. The rest of us, the Gunters, as in “egg hunters”... well, we didn’t have an excuse. We just had a dream.
Parzival strolls down a street lined with what look like homes, but are actually a row of “memory palaces”, basica auto-biographies represented in tangible form.

At this point, you're probably wondering why a nobody, me, is telling you his life story. The “titles” of these “books” float in front of the memor palaces in various fonts. As this is prime real estate, t are mostly people anyone from 2044 would know.
JaRICHARD CHENEY IV, MY LIFE AS A REBEL -- yes, Dick Chen grandson is the dreadlocked, blunt-smoking leader of the Rebs, known as JRC. That was him on the kid’s t-shirt earlier.

Point is this; I tell my story cause that's what Halliday did. He knew our lives would be memorialized in the Oasis, and people like me would want to know. Parzival passes “OGDEN MORROW, MY LIFE SO FAR”.  25. Finally he comes to the building he’s looking for; HALLID JOURNALS .

And if that seems grandiose on my part, if this seems like some rand- o day in the life of some rand-o nobody, it’s not. This is the day I stopped being a nobody. INT. HALLIDAY’S JOURNALS - OASIS Parzival enters a large lobby with many doors, each of th heading into a different part of Halliday’s life. THE HISTORIAN, a doddering NPC with an attitude, suddenly appears before him. (An NPC is a bot, an AI).
Parzival. How shocking to see you here.
What’s up, not-real but sarcastic program?
So, Halliday’s childhood again? Comb through his VHS library? Chew up my valuable search time?
Nah, today I need to check out something pretty obscure. Halliday’s one mistake. The Historian raises an eyebrow, intrigued.
His mistake. Flunkie Sprat Three?
(nods ) Yeah. This girl said something to me, I’ve been thinking about it all day.
I'm feigning interest.
(ignoring that) I mean, maybe it’s cause she’s hot. (MORE )
If she had said “I love pork rinds,” would I be thinking about pork rinds? Possibly...
Please, go on, I’m fascinated. He isn’t.
Damn, now I am thinking about pork rinds.
Is that the end? Great story, Parzival.
My point is, what if he made a mistake? INT. HALLIDAY’S JOURNALS - HALLWAY The Historian leads Parzival to a door. Parzival opens it steps inside.
With the contest, I mean. What if he made a mistake on purpose?

But for the presence of Parzival and the Historian, the recreation is absolutely flawless. We ARE in 1993, in the offices of Gregarious Games, where a much younger James Halliday, hung over, can’t stop talking about his night.

She's incredible, Ogden. I mean... I never met anyone like her. I drank too much, like an idiot, I’m a total lightweight. A frustrated OGDEN MORROW, rotund, with an unruly beard a wire-rimmed spectacles, is Halliday’s partner. He inspect the code Halliday has written for PD3.
(re: the code) What did you do here?
She told me to call her. Do I do that tomorrow? When? I’m terrible at this stuff.
Data is leaking all over the place.
I really do wonder why people bother with relationships, it’s incredibly messy and confusing.
Yeah, partnerships are that way too. Morrow pushes back from the desk.
You blew it this time, Hal.
I got the level finished.
Oh, it’s finished. With one minor bug. You did it backwards. Flunkie starts at the end and sprats his way backwards to the beginning.
Can’t we just reverse the...
The scene suddenly freezes. Parzival turns to the Histori
